public abstract class zeta.format.impl.CompoundFormat

(source file: impl/CompoundFormat.java)
java.lang.Object
   |
   +----zeta.format.Format
           |
           +----zeta.format.impl.NestedFormat
                   |
                   +----zeta.format.impl.CompoundFormat
The pure class interface. 
public abstract class CompoundFormat
  extends NestedFormat
This abstract class shall be inherited by all Format classes that are essentially built up out of a list of other Formats. It also implements the default-behaviour of printing such a compound Format.

This default behaviour prints each of the component Formats below the previous ones, printing a newline after each of them (except the last).

Here an example how text-rectangles are formed by formats beneath each other: 
  ...._______________________.....
  :  |                       |   :
  :  |                       |   :
  :  |             __________|   :
  :..|____________|______________:
  :    |                         |
  :    |   ______________________|
  :....|__|______................:
  :...|__________|

Author:
Jacob Wieland (ughosage@cs.tu-berlin.de)
See also:
NestedFormat, Format, FormatBlock, FormatBeside, FormatBeneath, FormatLine

CompoundFormat
public CompoundFormat(int indentation,
                      Format[] formats);
This constructor sets the indentation, the component formats and also computes the values for the minimal/maximal widths and height.

Parameters:
indentation - the own indentation of this CompoundFormat
formats - the component formats of this CompoundFormat
See also:
NestedFormat, Format

CompoundFormat

public CompoundFormat(Format[] formats);
This is a shortcut-constructor for CompoundFormats without own indentation.

CompoundFormat

public CompoundFormat(int indentation,
                      String text,
                      String delimiters);

Parameters:
indentation - the indenation of this compound format
text - a string that will be broken at the given delimiters The broken string is computed into an array of text, space and break Formats.
delimiters - the delimiter characters by which the text should be broken
